verbose_text: In the case of Ebola virus, the unusually complex entry requirements are (1) binding to a cell-surface receptor (TIM-1, Axl, heparan sulfate, and DC-SIGN); (2) macropinocytosis; (3) cleavage of GP at low pH by cathepsins; (4) binding to loop C of Niemann-Pick C1 cholesterol transporter in the endosome; and most likely, (5) a final trigger that drives GP to undergo the conformational changes required for membrane fusion.
